comment_data.body: @justinmk (sorry for @'ing you), perhaps you could offer some insight on that LSP error, is it something common?
Cannot recreate this. Did you install the server via Mason perhaps? Because it worked for me when I installed it manually via npm.

> Cannot recreate this. Did you install the server via Mason perhaps? Because it worked for me when I installed it manually via npm.

That's surprising. No, I actually have a very basic setup that just uses `lspconfig`: https://github.com/ndavd/dotfiles/blob/main/.config/nvim/lua/plugins/lspconfig.lua.

All I did was adding those options `compileUsingRemoteVersion = "0.8.26", defaultCompiler = "remote"`, to the `solidity_ls` config.

I have also installed the language server through npm (`npm 10.9.0`) `vscode-solidity-server@0.0.179`.

And I'm on `NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1576+g5dd60e01ac`.

EDIT: Would you mind sharing the config that worked for you and the versions of nvim, etc.?
I used nighty, `NVIM v0.11.0-dev-4735+g27da6f7757-Homebrew`. The config is the same as you used.

> I used nighty, `NVIM v0.11.0-dev-4735+g27da6f7757-Homebrew`. The config is the same as you used.

That's so odd. Did you try the language server (e.g. auto-completion) and it worked? I just tried on a brand new Foundry project and got the same result, but in any case I doubt it depends on the context that it's being used. Not sure what else I can try...
No, didn't try completion. Just check if server started.

I see this in both log posts:

> `[DEBUG][2025-01-15 21:01:48] .../vim/lsp/rpc.lua:393	"rpc.receive"	{ jsonrpc = "2.0", method = "window/logMessage", params = { message = "Notification handler 'workspace/didChangeConfiguration' failed with message: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'forEach')", type = 1 } }`


`Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'forEach')"` is a bug in some javascript module (not Nvim, nor nvim-lspconfig).

It's possible that Nvim is sending an unexpected message or settings that trigger the bug, but the first place to start is with whatever code has that bug. That code should instead say what Nvim sent that was wrong, assuming Nvim is sending something wrong.

Most like this is just a bug in the lsp server.

> `Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'forEach')"` is a bug in some javascript module (not Nvim, nor nvim-lspconfig).

That's a good point, didn't notice the `forEach` there. Thanks for the clarification.

title: solidity_ls settings not taking effect
